Description: Mould-made pottery carinated lamp with a double-convex body, a voluted nozzle, a small plain discus and a narrow channel from the discus to the wick-hole. The shoulder is decorated with a band of radiating patterns like tapering cylinders, within a raised line which follows the shape of the lamp. Within the base-ring is the impressed name COY.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2088)
